result.execSummary:
The defendant Destiny Shanae Earl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same. Transfer is authorized to a jail convenient to defendant's employment and or residence.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice. 
If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Joint and several with co-defendants, Tyesha Earl (22CF354) and Akia Harris (22CF355).
Defendant shall participate in all counseling, assessments, and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent.

Defendant shall have no contact with Washington County Walmart Stores.
Defendant shall have no contact with co-defendants, Tyesha Earl and Akia Harris.  
Defendant shall have no contact with Emmanuel Stevens.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Destiny Shanae Earl

records.addlTxt: Prosecuting Attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Destiny Shanae Earl in court and by Attorney Nolan A. Jensen.  State moves to amend Ct. 1 to three counts of Misd. Retail Theft as PTAC pursuant to sec. 943.50(1m)(a) and Court so orders.  No contest plea entered on Ct. 1, 2 and 3 as amended.  Court finds defendant guilty.  State to file an Information within 48 hours.  Argument by counsel.  Court proceeds to sentencing.

Prosecuting Attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Destiny Shanae Earl in court and by Attorney Nolan A. Jensen. Reading of Information waived.  Not guilty plea entered.

Prosecuting Attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Destiny Shanae Earl in court and by Attorney Nolan A. Jensen.  Counsel's first appearance. Preliminary hearing waived.  Court binds defendant over for trial and State shall file an Information.
Arraignment scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
No contact with E.S., No contact with any Washington County Walmart stores. No contact with co-defendants T.E. & A.H.

Prosecuting Attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant in custody and by Atty. Timothy Drewa. Co-defendant cases with Tyesha Earl 22CF354 and Akia Harris 22CF355.  Defendant given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Defendant eligible for State Public Defender.  Argument on bond.  $2,500 signature bond set. Preliminary hearing time limits waived.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing and to appear with counsel.
Hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 08:15 am.
